Message:
“I’m sure you’ll do great,”
my mother smiled.

I watched her, and all my
brothers and sisters wave
goodbye to me as I stepped
into the carriage bound
for the city.

Living in a poor farming village
with tons of children is...
difficult to say the least...

From a very early age,
I learned just how hard my
parents worked to support us.

Which is why,
following my family’s rule,
I left home at the age of 12—

just as all my older sisters
had done.

If I go somewhere
that has a lot of people,
there’s bound to be work to do.

I’d be lying if I said
I wasn’t worried...

But with just as much
anticipation overflowing in me,
I ventured into a new town.
